title: Super clean and QUIET ( no noise tolerated )
text:
Super clean and no carpeting. Our room was so tiny it didn’t have a closet. And if one is inside the bathroom while the other is outside washing hands — you could get bonked by the door! 
But the bed was comfy and roomy with a lovely city view. Can’t tell you about breakfast because every morning we went down- everything was gone. 
But here is how the hotel distinguished itself.
We had insane party people in the room next door who started playing music and dancing and singing at 5:30 AM. Insane.  When they refused to quiet down for us and for hotel staff - they got kicked out.
We were impressed. 
Would recommend, but maybe a larger room if there is one.

title: sem dúvidas, uma ótima escolha!
text: Tivemos uma excelente experiência durante nossos dias em NYC. O hotel é bem localizado, novo, limpo e dispõe de quartos aconchegantes com cama super macia e ótimas amenidades. Devemos destacar que os recepcionistas são muito cordiais, especialmente o Ruan, brasileiro que nos recebeu prestativo logo na chegada. Recomendamos!

title: Quiet Oasis in a great location - talk to the staff they are great !!
text:
This was a great hotel and the although not the swankiest or biggest this was a perfect location for visiting NY and is just walking distance to all the major attractions and perfect for Grand Central too. 
The hotel was a quiet retreat which was a great surprise in this bustling city. Lots of little touches too. Very clean to a very high standard, nice breakfast croissants and bagels, with good coffee. We stayed in a standard rooms which included nice big comfy bed and usual shampoos, shower gels and teas and coffee too, so you not need to bring any (unless you're a Brit in which case you will bring your own teabags...we all do !!). 
The best part though were the friendly and helpful staff. Everyone had a smile and if you don't take time to talk with these people its your loss. These are real New Yorkers and were so helpful, sharing their knowledge and advice which without doubt helped us enjoy our trip even more. Special mention goes out to Ruan though as he was wonderful and thanks to his advice gave us great places to go and also to avoid, and he was a great asset to your reception team.  Thanks Pestana, you helped make NY a fabulous trip

title: A stunning hotel in the perfect location!
text:
I chose this hotel because of the consistent fantastic reviews - which are all true! 

When you walk into reception, it looks & smells amazing. I booked this for my partner’s 50th birthday & emailed to ask for a special room if possible - we were given the most beautiful room on the 24th floor with a balcony and stunning city views, along with a complimentary bottle of fizz to celebrate! After long days out walking & sightseeing, I totally recommend choosing a city view room to unwind with incredible views. Equally, waking to the view each morning is amazing. 

The room is beautifully designed & looks exactly like the photos on the website. It’s immaculately clean, plenty under bed storage, the bed & pillows are super comfy, lovely complimentary toiletries, bathrobes & slippers. There is a little courtyard downstairs where the hotel provide complimentary coffee, croissants & bagels each morning. 

The location is perfect - a short walk to 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Centre, Bryant Park, The Empire State & Times Square. 

All staff at Pestana, from Housekeeping to Reception are professional, helpful & they genuinely want to make your stay perfect. We had a late flight and although check out is 11am, we were told to use the facilities to relax and have coffee and “treat it like home.” 

I can’t recommend this hotel enough, it ticks every box and more! I’ll definitely stay here next time I’m in New York!

title: Excelente
text:
La cama es comodísima, el olor de las sábanas y la almohada perfectas para el descanso.El pequeño desayuno gratuito q ofrecen es ideal.La atención de todo el personal es maravillosa.Agua y café disponible las 24 horas 
La habitación es pequeña,si, pero muy cómoda y el baño perfecto.Totalmente recomendable.

title: Beautiful welcoming hotel, perfect midtown location
text:
Fabulous hotel in the perfect location. Close to 5th Ave & Grand Central Station.
Large (by New York) standards, fully equipped, spotlessly clean room. Great grab & go breakfast & coffee bar. Hotel staff exceptional, so welcoming & helpful. Highly recommend this hotel, will definitely be back.

title: "This is your home"
text: The room is small but comfy. The amenities were nice and complete. It is also very nice that the shower is especially strong and high-flow. The croissant and coffee provided downstairs were really delicious. Thanks to everyone in this hotel who go above and beyond to make this hotel feel like home to us.  Every  staff of all departments are so friendly, especially Juan and Victor for the lovely chit chat each time we pass by the front desk. Do ask for rooms on the upper rooms, the view is lovely. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, and would definitely come back here myself.

title: Fabulous stay at Pestana!
text:
We had such a lovely time in NY and this hotel was great as It is perfectly located. The trip was to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. I emailed to ask if it was possible to have a room with a view and when we arrived on Wednesday, we were greeted by the lovely Victor (who was so friendly and efficient),  he said that for the following 3 nights of our stay we would have a complimentary upgrade!!  Our initial room was lovely and comfy but small and without a view but the following day we went to our new room on the 23rd floor which was fabulous, with lovely views across the city and a balcony. The bed was super comfy, the shower was absolutely amazing and powerful, lovely fluffy towels and great toiletries. All the equipment is really good quality and importantly, clean. I would absolutely recommend this hotel. The staff were so friendly and helpful all the time; one member of staff even lent us his umbrella when it was pouring with rain. 

Even though the room has a coffee machine, the ground floor of the hotel has coffee & tea making facilities and complimentary croissants & bagels as a grab & go (or stay) breakfast.  We also chose to go round the corner to a place called Tartinery for breakfast, which was lovely, fresh and with healthy options. 

We would definitely stay here again a heartbeat . Thank you  Victor and all the staff for making our stay so special.

title: Great & calm place in central Manhattan
text: Great and calm place in central Manhattan! Many attractions, restaurants at walking distance. We also very much appreciated the availability of tea, coffee, water  in the pantry including fresh bagels, croissants at breakfast time.

title: Muy buena experiencia
text:
Hotel moderno, limpio, habitaciones luminosas, con maquina de café a disposición (un extra importante!) y agua de cortesía. Mi único comentario es que yendo en pareja con 2 valijas normales y una chica, resulta muy justo el tamaño de la habitación. 
Por el resto perfecto!

title: Mejor hotel en NYC
text: Excelente ubicación! Las piezas no son grandes, pero son muy cómodas, limpias y modernas. El baño también es espectacular. Los de recepción Liu amables. Lo recomiendo 200% es tercera vez que nos quedamos acá.

title: Most comfortable stay in NYC
text: Pestana truly felt like a luxury experience, even though my friend and I were on a budget. Keener and Ruan were extremely helpful and allowed us to check in early, and even stashed our bags for us the day of our checkout. They have a 24/7 coffee machine which actually makes pretty good coffee (!) as well as an amazing complimentary breakfast. The room was pretty small, but was super light and airy so it didn’t feel like a closet, as many other NYC hotel rooms do. The beds were so so comfortable, and the amenities in the room were high quality. They had a single serve espresso maker and VSOS water which was wonderful. It was also extremely quiet during our stay, even though the walls were thin, which is also hard to find in NYC. We will definitely be coming back!

title: The Perfect NYC Boutique Hotel
text: I had the BEST experience with Pestana Park Ave. I ultimately chose to stay here because of the great reviews, and I have to say that the reviews are all 100% true! I came to NYC for an audition and to explore the city, so I was looking for something close to Time Square but not too close, a comfortable bed, quiet, clean, CUTE, and in a safe area. It checked off every single thing on my list! Every single staff member was friendly, helpful, and went above and beyond to make you feel welcomed and comfortable. My flight arrived early and  I decided to go straight to the hotel to see if my room happened to be ready. Brandon at the front desk was awesome and able to get me an early check-in and straight into a room. They have a nepresso in the room, minibar with snacks/drinks, and a large complimentary bottle of Voss which you could refill downstairs from their water filter in the lounge area which came in CLUTCH as I drink a lot of water. They also had coffee/tea, croissants, and bagels in the lounge every morning. I like to go out into the city for breakfast, so hotel breakfast was not important to me. They have a cute patio outside as well. The shower was incredible - water pressure great and the water heated up immediately. Bed was super comfy and plenty of pillows. The housekeeping staff was amazing and so nice. One of the days I couldn't figure out the thermostat, and I opened my door to ask one of the housekeepers and she said she would send maintenance up to help. Within 10 minutes I had a staff member at my door who was able to fix it in a few minutes. Pestana Park Ave is a charming boutique hotel in NYC and I will be staying here every chance I get when I come to the city!

text: This was a very small but cute and updated hotel. It was perfect for our one night stay in NYC and it had everything we needed. Don’t think I would have been able to stay for more than a few nights though considering how small the space is. The 5 minute walk from Grand Central was super convenient! Overall, very happy with our stay :)

title: Nice stay
text:
The rooms and the location were very nice. Very close to 5th avenue and Times Square which is pleasant. Also, close to the central station. 
We want to thank Ruan for being so kind and a great receptionist. Muito obrigado!

title: Super hotel

The rooms were very clean and with a nice view. The hotel is also close to many things. Nothing bad to say about our stay here. We recommend this hotel.

title: Very advisable!

text: The rooms were supper clean when we arrived with a sweet note left for us from the cleaning staff. The room is large enough to be comfortable.  The bathroom has amazing water pressure and it’s clear that it’s been recently renovated. ROUN from the morning staff and the manage Lilly went out of their way to make our stay exceptional. We needed some thread and sent it up and accommodate us when we needed a slightly later check out (granted it was not too busy so they were able to.) I personally can’t say the same about the night staff - he was a bit ruff.  Not the most welcoming, and we checked in at night so we assumed the stay would be fine, seeing he was not really that pleasant BUT the morning staff honestly makes up for it and I honestly can’t recommend this place enough!

title: Amazing hotel!
text: This hotel has every comfort that you need, all the privacy that you need and is near to the central station and times square. I’ve loved everything! Modern hotel, clean and organized . Thank you pestana park avenue ❤️ p.s we are italians, from Napoli :)

title: Quick weekend get away
text: Great no frills European style hotel, location is perfect with discounted parking directly across the street and within walking distance to theatres and dining.   The staff was very accommodating and helpful.  Will definitely stay at the Pestana Park Ave hotel next time we are in NYC.

title: A week in the Big Apple
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights and have to say it was a pleasure. 
Small but perfectly adequate room with comfy bed and pillows super shower and great big TV 
The staff were super friendly and helpful and the free coffee and bagels must of saved us 100 dollars with NY prices 

The location is excellent 2 min walk to Grand Central and loads of major tourist attractions with in easy walking distance of the hotel 
And with Grand Central on your door step everywhere was easily accessible 
Would definitely recommend for a short break holiday in NY

title: Dishonest fotos - the smallest room ever!
text: The smallest room I have ever stayed in - the so-called superior room did not have any places for clothes and I had to sleep with my suitcase on the bed as there was not even enough room to open in on the floor. The only seating was actually under the TV. There was also a lot of noise from the other rooms on the floor. The only upside was free coffee and bagels available on a first come gust serve basis in a tiny kitchen room on the ground floor. Would not stay here again for more than one night and without luggage. Also the water was off due a fault in the street and no attempt was made to communicate with staff so I also ended up taking a cold shower in January!

title: Terrific experience. Central, comfortable, great staff
text:
Well designed rooms with comfortable beds and in a great location.  But the big draw is the quality of the charming and helpful staff
I had a room in the 26th floor with anal only, a rare amenity in New York. Room is compact but very well designed and more than adequate

title: Great Location, Great Hotel.
text:
This is a brand new and a very nicely located hotel.
The front office staff is so helpful, smiley and professional.
The hotel is nicely located and served complimentary american breakfast which also adds a lot of value. We found the room a little small in the beginng and being in NYC for 10 days, we had a lot of luggage but it is so nicely and wisely decorated that we settled in so comfortably and had a stay like at home. The bed and pillows and all fabrics are chosen for a super comfy stay.
We now became a Pestana Fan and we will be staying in another Pestana in our future holiday. Thank you to all the team.

title: Awesome NYC stay
text: Pestana Park Avenue, a stone throw away from Grand Central Station, Empire State Building, Bryant Park,Rockefeller Center and an endless amount of NYC attractions within a short walking distance from local transit to reach all parts of NYC was complemented by AMAZING, kind, helpful hotel staff, modern, clean, comfortable rooms which included breakfast that just added to our exceptional experience! title: Boa estadia.
text:

Os funcionários foram solícitos e nos auxiliaram nas nossas dúvidas.
Não houve nenhum problema na nossa estadia, apenas não demos uma nota maior por o hotel ter pouca estrutura. Dentro da proposta, voltaríamos a nos hospedar lá.

title: I would definitely come back.
text: The room was emasculate and clean, when we got there we were greeted by the manager Lilly and she gave us a early check in, and it was very appreciative, and the whole staff of pestana park avenue was helpful and they treat you like your home away from home, the guest lounge area it was always kept clean and modern, there is free complementary coffee, and the attendant lady was greet-able.

title: As good as we hoped for during the holiday season!

title: Wonderful
text:

text: Great hotel - compact but stylish, modern and comfortable. The staff were great, bagels and coffee for breakfast appreciated, and the  beds were extremely comfortable. title: Great NYC Find
text:
This hotel was incredibly convenient for coming into the city via Grand Central (google maps says 7min walk but it really we found it to be less than 5).  It very is easily walkable to anything in the Times Square/Bryant Park/Mid-Town area and there are tons of places to eat/drink round around the hotel.

We extra appreciated the complimentary bottle of VOS water in the room and how friendly and helpful the staff was.  

The room was small, but this is expected in NYC and we did book the cheapest option and so if you want more room be sure to upgrade.  The bed was very comfortable and the shower was great.   

The only downfall we encountered is that it seems they do not allow for any early check-in's and so there is a mass rush (in a very tiny lobby with only one computer and staff member) to check everyone in at exactly 3pm.  This gave us a bit of a heart attack trying to check in and still have time to change and make a 4pm reservation, but if we to stay again we would plan around this now that we know.  That said, I would recommend management look into adding a computer station and staff member if they are not going to allow early check in to minimize this situation. 

Overall though, I would recommend this hotel and we would definitely stay here again if the price was right!

Down to the housekeepers say good morning and ask me how my stay is going which made me feel very at home in this hotel. I will most definitely return.

title: Para huir, personal nada resolutivo
text:
Elegí Pestana Park Avenue, por otras experiencias en otros Pestana en otras ubicaciones. 
La habitación es absolutamente ridícula, sin armarios, con cajones para la ropa debajo de la cama, lo cual en invierno obliga a tener la ropa tirada por toda la habitación. El lavamanos está fuera del lavabo dentro de la propia habitación, sin sitio para neceser. Pero ello es asumible, estamos en NYC y sabemos como son los hoteles.
El problema vino al hacer el check in, me cobran 2.589,13 euros, cuando estaba todo pagado de origen, diciendo que el intermediario no les había pagado esta cantidad... qué intermediario si contraté directamente en la web de Pestana?. Tras mucho reclamar (5 días), todo ello en inglés con el "simpático" BRANDON, un tipo del todo impresentable, prepotente que llegó a tirarme la tarjeta de Pestana servicios centrales porque el no llamaba para solucionar el tema. Al 5º día apareció Lily, supuestamente responsable del front office, diciendo lo mismo que si el intermediario, etc. cuando repito contraté directamente en Pestana, igual todo ello en inglés porque en la 2º ciudad que más turistas recibe, en el front office no hay nadie que hable castellano. Al final me devolvieron 2.286,23 euros una vez en Barcelona, o sea por el camino se han quedado 302,90 euros, que ni Pestana Park Avenue ni Servicios centrales de Pestana me dan ninguna explicación, ni tan siquiera las facturas que he reclamado infinidad de veces para cursar la correspondiente denuncia, tanto a Pestana como a VISA para que retrocedan todos los cargos indebidos. Al final me han devuelto 45 euros por molestias causadas.
Sigo teniendo la sensación que tanto BRANDON como LILY, se han estado riendo en mi cara durante toda la estancia, dándome largas y no haciendo nada por solucionar un problema de un huesped.
En todos mis viajes a NYC 4 con este, y por todo el mundo nunca me he sentido tan maltratado como en PESTANA PARK AVENUE, 
lo único que le salva es la ubicación, pero en esa misma zona hay cientos de ofertas de hoteles mismas características pero infinidad de mejor trato. 
J. Luis

title: Outstanding!!
text: Upon arrival we were greeted by Hector who made our trip unforgettable after upgrading my son and I to a balcony room when he learned that we were celebrating a birthday and graduation. He also offered us water bottles and a souvenir to complete our welcome and continued to provide excellent service to us throughout the week. The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was modern and included a rain head shower. We had an incredible view of the city from both the room and the balcony. We appreciated coming back to a cool, quiet room after a hot humid day exploring the city. Also included in the room was a Nespresso machine, which was a nice addition. The location was perfect as it was a short walk to Grand Central Station, The Empire State building, and Times Square. I highly recommend choosing Pestana Park Avenue, especially if you are planning on exploring the city as the location was fantastic and the service was second to none.

title: Great small hotel, excellent location, reasonable (NYC!) prices
text: Pestana Park Avenue exceeded expectations. My husband and I needed accommodations for just one night during the holiday season. Unlike many other hotels, PPA did not have a two-night minimum, and prices were reasonable (at least by NYC standards).  The hotel is in a great midtown location, staff was friendly, and checking in and out was easy.  Rooms are modern, very clean, and there are only 4 to a floor.  Bed was comfy and shower was terrific.  But be forewarned that rooms are small.  Ours was perfect for a one-night stay and for two average-sized people.  If you are staying longer or are a bigger person (especially if you're part of a couple) you may want something larger than the Superior Room.  But overall a great experience.

title: Comfy beds and great location!
text:
Had a great stay here! The rooms are small, but it was perfect for a solid traveler. Loved that the beds were on a platform - it was so cozy especially with a city view. The bed is so comfortable and the pillows are amazing. I was wondering if you could tell me where they are from? I’d love to get some for my guest room at home! 

Location is great. The coffee and pastries in the mornings were also fantastic. Well appointed rooms, very clean, warm staff. I will definitely be back!

title: Modern and clean, but spartan
text: This is a nice little hotel just off Madison Avenue. The location is great, convenient to the subway and a reasonable walk from Penn Station. The thing I appreciated most is that the rooms are new, with clean wood-look floors instead of iffy-looking carpet. It was a welcome contrast to the many old, funny-smelling hotels around Manhattan that haven't been updated in ages. The bathroom is a riff on a European design, with a handheld wand as well as the showerhead and only a small curb to delineate the shower. The rooms are spartan but thoughtfully laid out and the Nespresso machine was welcome touch in the morning. The hotel actually has a normal nightly maid service, which has been depressingly rare since covid and they replaced my dirty coffee cup, added Nespresso pods, made the bed, and put out a fresh bath mat. HVAC is good, with the ability to run the fan so the room doesn't get stuffy. I didn't opt for a room with a view so mine looked out onto an office building, but there were sheer privacy curtains and nobody there in the evening so it wasn't a problem. The only major annoyance was that the refrigerator was set up as a mini-bar and wasn't cold. I have food sensitivities and count on having a fridge so that was a problem. The "classic" room I chose also turned out to be very poorly lit in the evening, making it hard to consolidate my notes. Don't plan on doing anything that requires more than a bedside reading lamp after dark. I couldn't see my knitting and I had to stand by the sink under the only decent light in the room to even do my nails. The lobby does offer better-lit seating, plus water and coffee available 24 hours if you don't mind the lack of privacy. There also isn't a closet, and my business clothes barely fit on the provided hangers and pegs. I'd probably stay here again because I liked the modern aesthetic and the cleanness but I'd bring a folding LED light and wrinkle-free clothes.

title: Everything I needed for my stay in NYC
text:
I was on a business trip to NYC and had an excellent stay at Pestana Park Avenue hotel. The room was clean, well finished and modern, with a mini fridge, safe, coffee maker, and a small table I was able to work from with my laptop. Downstairs there was also a shared lounge with a coffee machine, and an outside seating area. 

It is well located for food, shops and amenities, and if you get time for sightseeing, there are some popular tourist sites nearby as well. Transport links are good if you have to travel a little further with Central Station about a 5 minute walk.

The staff were super friendly and I really enjoyed getting to know them during my stay. I was early on my arrival and on my checkout day, they held my luggage and helped organise transport to the airport later in the evening. I appreciated how helpful and accommodating everyone was. 

I'd definitely stay here again in future.

title: Great stay, perfect location!
text:
We stayed at Pestana Park Avenue for 9 nights and it did not disappoint. Yes, the room is quite small, but it's normal for NY and, having read many reviews about it, we were prepared and to be honest, they made it sound worse than it actually is. (We had a superior room though, so not sure about the standard). But other than that the room was really nice and cozy, clean, and with a lovely and modern design.
The hotel staff was really nice, we asked for a room with an outdoor view and they were really nice to accommodate us and it was well worth it, waking up with a view of NY's buildings made a difference. I think that from the upper floors you can even see the Empire State Building.
But most importantly....the location: PERFECT. It's so central I couldn't have wished for better. Walking distance to Bryant Park (where we went for breakfast most days), Met Building, Grand Central Station, the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, 5th Ave...
I would 100% recommend it and I'll definitely be back next time.

title: Great stay at Pestana!
text: I have stayed at Pestana twice now and both times had great experiences. The first time I decided to stay an additional night after a work trip and Pestana last minute was able to accommodate me. I was back a week later for another work trip and this time had my mom joining me. Let me first highlight Brandon because he was amazing! He made it work so my mom and I got a larger room with a balcony & view!! Brandon was so kind, went above & beyond and made sure we had everything all set for a great stay. A couple other notes, I love that they have an indoor and outdoor area to hang out if you're waiting for a flight, Uber etc. They also store your luggage, have a refillable water machine (this is huge for me) and the rooms are so quiet. Having stayed at quite a few NYC hotels, I was shocked at how quiet my room was both times. The rooms may be small, but they have everything you need and I love the espresso pods & cute espresso mugs they have in the room. Would definitely recommend Pestana Park whether you're there for a short or longer visit!

title: Amazing Experience
text:
We picked the Pestana Park Avenue for our Honeymoon and didn’t regret a single moment of our stay.

The booking process was simple and upon my correspondence with Lilly, Director of Front Office, that we were going to spend our Honeymoon (we got married in NYC) with them, we were given an upgrade to a room with a spectacular view.

The room itself was cozy and romantic and we couldn’t have asked for more. While the rooms are quite small, they are big in design and coziness. They have a mini bar, a Nespresso machine, free water and amenities like a hair dryer, a steamer, a safety locker and coat hangers. 

Needless to say, the room was super clean and towels were exchanged on a daily basis.

But there were two things that really stood out:
1) The Staff: They were extremely friendly and helpful and went above and beyond to make our stay super special. Of course, you don’t get married every day and we were constantly asked how our wedding was, if we needed anything - but we could also observe how other guests were asked the same thing. 
From Front Desk Manager to Cleaning Staff, we were provided with an outstanding, tailored, genuine and respectful service and loved every minute of our stay.

2) The Location: Being located at 39 St/Maddison Av, the location is not just great, but amazing! From our room, we could actually partially see the Empire State Building and spots like the 5 Av, Central Park, Times Sq., Central St., Rockefeller Bldg. — everything was in walking distance.

We couldn’t have asked for more on our honeymoon and look forward to coming back very, very soon!

title: I’ll be back to Pestana!

title: Great little hotel
text:

The rooms are NYC size - don’t expect loads of space but we had a separate shower room and the decor was nice and modern which we liked. We really like each other so had no issue with the room being a little small and it is to be expected in NYC so be mindful of that and manage your expectations accordingly. Hanging clothes a little challenging at times but an ingenious mirror with hanging space behind and an under bed drawer did the trick. 
Loved the bagels in the mornings that was a great touch and free coffee machine 24/7 was a life saver. I’ve machine also.
The staff were all fantastic and really helpful, room cleaned to a good standard each day too.
I’d definitely recommend this hotel for a city break - we stayed for 6 nights and had no issues while we stayed there. Bed was very comfortable too!
